title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita

title: Gapminder Analysis
text:
Welcome to Gapminder Analysis
The Gapminder dataset provides insights into global development trends, including life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time.

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Country Analysis
text:
Country-Specific Trends
country = “India” # Change this to any country of interest
country_data = df[df[“country”] == country]
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6)) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“life_expectancy”], label=“Life Expectancy”, marker=“o”) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“gdp_per_capita”], label=“GDP per Capita”, marker=“s”) plt.plot(country_data[“year”], country_data[“population_millions”], label=“Population (Millions)”, marker=“^”) plt.xlabel(“Year”) plt.legend() plt.title(f”Trends in {country}“) plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy & GDP Per Capita
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.
import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


Load dataset
df = pd.read_csv(“gapminder.csv”)


Plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6)) for year in df.year.unique(): subset = df[df.year == year] plt.scatter(subset[‘gdp_per_capita’], subset[‘life_expectancy’], label=year, alpha=0.5) plt.xscale(‘log’) plt.xlabel(“GDP per Capita (Log Scale)”) plt.ylabel(“Life Expectancy”) plt.title(“Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita Over Time”) plt.legend() plt.show()
